definition: to stretch in an unbroken chain (esp. of mountains)
extending all the way across/running all the way through

sentences.english: Rows of winter wheat wind their way to the Colorado horizon.
sentences.chinese: 美國科羅拉多州，成行成排的冬小麥綿亙不絕。

sentences.english: The continuous rain , recmy missing for you.
sentences.chinese: 綿亙不斷的細雨，勾起我對你的掛念。

sentences.english: With 40 lakes which extend five kilometers along a valley, the spot covers an area of three square kilometers.
sentences.chinese: 四十個海子沿山谷綿亙五公里，幅員三平方公里。

sentences.english: Even my mother won't let me forget about what lies ahead.
sentences.chinese: 就連媽媽也不會叫我忘了綿亙在眼前的難題。
